key_insight: StereoPilot replaces the fragile multi-stage Depth–Warp–Inpaint pipeline with a single, unified model that leverages generative priors to produce high-quality stereo views from monocular video, handling occlusions and format conversions more robustly and efficiently.
problem_solved: Addresses error propagation, depth ambiguity, occlusion filling failures, and format inconsistency (parallel vs converged stereo) in automatic monocular-to-stereo conversion.
method: Train a unified converter that conditions on a monocular frame plus geometry cues and uses generative priors to synthesize the complementary view in one stage, avoiding sequential D→W→I errors.
Incorporate geometry-aware modules (disparity/epipolar constraints) and a format adapter to support both parallel and converged stereo layouts.
Leverage generative priors for realistic appearance, robust occlusion hallucination, and compact/efficient inference compared to multi-step pipelines.
impact: Simplifies and stabilizes monocular-to-stereo conversion, making high-quality stereo content generation more accessible for VR/3D production and enabling practitioners to integrate stereo synthesis into real-time or resource-constrained pipelines.

paper_title: StereoPilot: Learning Unified and Efficient Stereo Conversion via Generative Priors
paper_authors: Guibao Shen, Yihua Du, Wenhang Ge, Jing He, Chirui Chang
